intro: Acinodendron brachybotryum, commonly known as the short-fruited acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, typical of many shrubs in its family. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Acinodendron brachybotryum is often found in rocky or sandy soils in woodland or shrubland habitats.
